document.docTitle: Amynthas endophilus Zhao and Qiu 2013, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Four new species of genus Amynthas (Oligochaeta, Megascolecidae) from Hainan Island, China

paragraph.heading:
Amynthas endophilus Zhao and Qiu
, sp. nov.

caption.paragraph: Table 1. NCBI registration and accession numbers of sequence fragments of earthworm species generated or compared in this study.

Table 2. K2P distances of COI sequences (bottom left) and combined COI and 16S sequences (top right) among
Amynthas species
in China mainland, Taiwan Island and Hainan Island.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype : Clitellate specimen (C-HN201011-03): 96 mm long, 3 mm wide, 159 segments. Setae numbers: 56/III, 72/ V , 84/ VIII ; 25( VI ) between spermathecal pores, 2( XVIII ) between male pores; collected in the black loam near the river which is behind the hotel in
Diaoluoshan National Forest Park
, south-east Hainan ,
18 ‚ó¶ 43 ‚Ä≤ 49 ‚Ä≤‚Ä≤ N
,
109 ‚ó¶ 52 ‚Ä≤ 03 ‚Ä≤‚Ä≤ E
, at an altitude of
933 m
.
Collected by J. P. Qiu , Q. Zhao , J. B. Jiang , D. Cluzeau and W. K. Zhang
. Paratype : 1 clitellate (C-HN201011-03(1)): same data as for holotype.
Some data as for holotype, 1 aclitellate specimen.
The species is named after its ecological type . It was collected from deep soil and is without pigmentation. It is an endogeic species.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 1.
Amynthas endophilus
sp. nov. (A) ventral body surface with spermathecal pores; (B) spermatheca; (C) ventral body surface with male pores; (D) Intestinal caeca.

subSubSection.paragraph: Spermathecal pores two pairs, ventral, in 5/6‚Äì6/7, about 0.4 body circumference apart. No genital markings in this region. Male pores a little less than 0.33 body circumference apart, ventrally placed, each on top of a round glandular porophore, surrounded by four skin folds. No genital papillae in this region.

Preserved specimens no pigmentation. Dimensions 96 mm by 3 mm ; segments 159. Setae intensive, regularly distributed around segmental equators, their numbers: 56 at III, 72 at V, 84 at VIII; 25(VI) between spermathecal pores, 2(XVIII) between male pores; setal formula AA = 1.4AB, ZZ = 2ZY. Female pore single in the centre of XIV ventrally, ovoid, brown. First dorsal pore in 12/13. Prostomium 1/2 epilobous. Clitellum in XIV‚ÄìXVI, ring-shaped, light greyish, markedly glandular; setae, dorsal pore and annulus invisible.

Male pores paired in XVIII, a little less than 0.33 body circumference apart, ventrally placed, each on top of a round glandular porophore, surrounded by four skin folds. Genital papillae absent. Spermathecal pores two pairs, ventral, in 5/6‚Äì6/7, each eye-shaped and obvious, distance between paired pores about 0.4 body circumference apart. Genital markings absent.

Septa 8/9, 9/10 absent; 5/6‚Äì7/8 comparatively thick and muscular; 10/11‚Äì12/13 a little thicker than those following. Gizzard ball-shaped, in IX‚ÄìX. Intestine starting enlarged in XV. Intestinal caeca simple, originating in XXVII, extending anterior to XXIV, dark brown. Oesophageal hearts four pairs, in X‚ÄìXIII, the last three more developed.

Spermathecae two pairs, in VI‚ÄìVII, 2.3 mm long; ampulla elongated ovoid, duct a little shorter than ampulla, diverticulum 1.8 mm long, ental 0.6 dilated, serving as zonal seminal chamber, silvery white. Testis-sacs paired in X and XI, both separate ventrally. Seminal vesicles paired in XI and XII, stout and developed, both separate ventrally. Prostate gland in XVII‚ÄìXXI, developed, racemose, and divided into five to six main lobes, with a 6- or U-shaped duct, uniform in calibre.

Amynthas endophilus
sp. nov. keys to the morrisi- group according to Sims and Easton (1972) . Compared to the
Amynthas species
reported from China and South-East Asia with two pairs of spermathecal pores in 5/6‚Äì6/7 ( Chen 1931 , 1933 , 1936 , 1938 , 1946 ; Gates 1935 , 1939a , 1939b ; Chen et al. 1975 ; Chen and Hsu 1977 ; Ding 1985 , Tsai 1964 ; 1972; Qiu and Wen 1987 ; Hong and James 2001 , 2004 , 2008 ; James et al. 2005 ; Hong 2007 , 2011 ),
Amynthas endophilus
sp. nov. is most similar to
Amynthas morrisi (Beddard, 1892)
. Both of them are moderate-sized species. Their spermathecae are similar: both of them have an ovoid ampulla and a slender duct which is a little shorter than the ampulla; the diverticulum is shorter than the main pouch with a zonal seminal chamber. Furthermore, both of them have two pairs of spermathecal pores in 5/6‚Äì6/7, no septa in 8/9‚Äì9/10, racemose prostate gland and simple intestinal caeca. However, they differ by the pigmentation, genital markings, genital papillae, first dorsal pore and gizzard.
Amynthas endophilus
sp. nov. has no pigmentation while
Amynthas morrisi
is brownish dorsally and grey ventrally.
Amynthas endophilus
sp. nov. has neither genital markings nor genital papillae. In contrast, genital markings are sometimes present in
Amynthas morrisi
and
Amynthas morrisi
always has genital papillae pre- and post-male pores. The first dorsal pore of
Amynthas endophilus
sp. nov. is in 12/13 while that of
Amynthas morrisi
is in 11/12. The gizzard of
Amynthas endophilus
sp. nov. is in IX‚ÄìX, while that of
Amynthas morrisi
is in IX or VIII‚ÄìIX ( Table 3 ). An NJ tree and K2P distances among
Amynthas species
(
morrisi
-group) in China mainland, Taiwan Island and Hainan Island are shown in Figure 5 and in Table 2 . The distance between COI markings if present, small, if present, paired

sequences of
Amynthas endophilus
sp. nov. and the other four
Amynthas species
are all more than 20%. Furthermore, the distances of the combined COI and 16S sequences were>13%. Sequences of COI and 16S genes of
Amynthas endophilus
were deposited in GenBank under Accession No. JQ911673 and JQ911674 ( Table 1 ).
